definition[0]: to work together with a person or group in order to achieve something, especially in science or art
example[0]: The two nations are collaborating on several satellite projects.
example[1]: During the late seventies, he collaborated with the legendary Muddy Waters.
example[2]: Researchers are collaborating to develop the vaccine.
example[3]: Elephants collaborate in looking after their young.
explanation[0]: In everyday English, people usually say they work together on something rather than collaborate on something:
example[4]: They are working together on some new songs.
definition[1]: to help a country that your country is fighting a war with, especially one that has taken control of your country
example[5]: Vigilantes began combing the city for anyone known to have collaborated with the enemy.
definition[2]: to work together with another person, company, or organization to achieve something
example[6]: Firms are collaborating with other firms to spread rising research and development costs.
example[7]: They will collaborate on a series of research projects.
